intro: Psychotria alatipes, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive hairy texture. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in terminal inflorescences. Psychotria alatipes is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
